meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or duty.
meanings.sent1: The skiver always finds excuses to avoid helping with chores.
meanings.sent2: The boss was frustrated with the skiver who never completed tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The skiver's talent for dodging responsibilities was both impressive and annoying.
meanings.sent4: She was a master skiver, slipping away from work unnoticed like a shadow.
meanings.sent5: The image of the skiver lounging while others toiled away stuck in everyone's mind.

meanings.definition: To avoid work or duty by pretending to be ill or busy.
meanings.sent1: He would often skiver by feigning a sudden headache when asked to help.
meanings.sent2: She decided to skiver off work by pretending to have a doctor's appointment.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it was funny when their dad tried to skiver out of mowing the lawn.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to skiver her way out of difficult tasks amazed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The employee's constant skivering eventually caught the attention of the supervisor.
